text: BALB / c mice were injected intravenously ( i.v . ) with a red blood cell - depleted single-cell spleen suspension ( 2.5 x 107 cells ) ( Castro et al . , 2000 ) from DO11.10 WT or <extra_id_0> STAT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - deficient mice .
After 48 hr , they were injected subcutaneously with PBS or with <extra_id_0> OVA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein ( 5 mg ) plus LPS ( 5 mug ) .
The inguinal lymph nodes were removed 48 hr later .
A single-cell suspension ( 1 x 106 cells ) was restimulated for 24 or 48 hr with 1 muM or 3 muM of <extra_id_0> OVA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and with BrefeldinA for the last 6 hr .
Half of the supernatant was removed before the addition of BrefeldinA for use in an ELISA assay .
The cells were fixed and stained as before .

Those positive for <extra_id_0> KJ1-26 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Bio and for <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - PerCP were gated , and <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> staining was examined for this population and analyzed as before .
